content:
DisplayAttribute Class

In this Article

Provides a general-purpose attribute that lets you specify localizable strings for types and members of entity partial classes.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Method | System.AttributeTargets.Property | System.AttributeTargets.Field | System.AttributeTargets.Parameter, AllowMultiple=false)]
public sealed class DisplayAttribute : Attribute

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Attribute
  • DisplayAttribute

Remarks

The properties of this class can be used either as literals or as resource identifiers for a specified ResourceType instance.

Constructors summary

DisplayAttribute()

Initializes a new instance of the DisplayAttribute class.

Properties summary

AutoGenerateField

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether UI should be generated automatically in order to display this field.
AutoGenerateFilter

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether filtering UI is automatically displayed for this field.
Description

Gets or sets a value that is used to display a description in the UI.
GroupName

Gets or sets a value that is used to group fields in the UI.
Name

Gets or sets a value that is used for display in the UI.
Order

Gets or sets the order weight of the column.
Prompt

Gets or sets a value that will be used to set the watermark for prompts in the UI.
ResourceType

Gets or sets the type that contains the resources for the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ShortName*, stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Name*, stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Prompt*, and stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description* properties.
ShortName

Gets or sets a value that is used for the grid column label.

Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.AutoGenerateField* property.
GetAutoGenerateFilter()

Returns a value that indicates whether UI should be generated automatically in order to display filtering for this field.

Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description* property.
GetGroupName()

Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.GroupName* property.
GetName()

Returns a value that is used for field display in the UI.
GetOrder()

Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Order* property.

Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Prompt* property.

Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ShortName* property.

Constructors

  • DisplayAttribute()

    Initializes a new instance of the DisplayAttribute class.

    public DisplayAttribute ();

    Remarks

    The constructor initializes the ShortName, Name, Description, and Prompt properties to an empty string.

Properties

  • AutoGenerateField

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether UI should be generated automatically in order to display this field.

    public bool AutoGenerateField { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if UI should be generated automatically to display this field; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      An attempt was made to get the property value before it was set.

    Remarks

    Do not use this property to access the AutoGenerateField property. Use the GetAutoGenerateField method instead.

  • AutoGenerateFilter

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether filtering UI is automatically displayed for this field.

    public bool AutoGenerateFilter { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if UI should be generated automatically to display filtering for this field; otherwise, false.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      An attempt was made to get the property value before it was set.

    Remarks

    Do not use this property to get the value of the AutoGenerateFilter property. Use the GetAutoGenerateFilter method instead.

    Setting this property overrides the default behavior for specifying which columns are included as filters.

    Example

    The following example shows how to disable the filter for the Employee1 field. 

    [MetadataType(typeof(EmployeeMD))]  
public partial class Employee {  
    public class EmployeeMD {  
        [Display(Name = "Last Name", Order = -9,   
            Prompt = "Enter Last Name", Description="Emp Last Name")]  
        public object LastName { get; set; }  

        [Display(Name = "Manager", AutoGenerateFilter=false)]  
        public object Employee1 { get; set; }  
    }  
}  

    <MetadataType(GetType(EmployeeMD))>  _  
Public Class Employee  

    Public Class EmployeeMD  

        <Display(Name:="Last Name", Order:=-9, _  
           Prompt:="Enter Last Name", Description:="Emp Last Name")>  _  
        Public Property LastName As Object  
        End Property  

        <Display(Name:="Manager", AutoGenerateFilter:=false)>  _  
        Public Property Employee1 As Object  
        End Property  
    End Class  
End Class
  • Description

    Gets or sets a value that is used to display a description in the UI.

    public string Description { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The value that is used to display a description in the UI.

    Remarks

    Do not use this property to get the value of the Description property. Use the GetDescription method instead.

    The Description property is typically used as a tooltip or description UI element that is bound to the member using this attribute. The Dynamic Data Edit.ascx template will display the description as a tooltip in text-entry fields. A null value or empty string is valid.

    Example

    The following example shows how to set the Description property. 

    [MetadataType(typeof(EmployeeMD))]  
public partial class Employee {  
    public class EmployeeMD {  
        [Display(Name = "Last Name", Order = -9,   
        Prompt = "Enter Last Name", Description="Emp Last Name")]  
        public object LastName { get; set; }  

        [Display(Name = "Manager", AutoGenerateFilter=false)]  
        public object Employee1 { get; set; }  
    }  
}  

    <MetadataType(GetType(EmployeeMD))>  _  
Public Class Employee  

    Public Class EmployeeMD  

        <Display(Name:="Last Name", Order:=-9, _  
           Prompt:="Enter Last Name", Description:="Emp Last Name")>  _  
        Public Property LastName As Object  
        End Property  

        <Display(Name:="Manager", AutoGenerateFilter:=false)>  _  
        Public Property Employee1 As Object  
        End Property  
    End Class  
End Class
  • GroupName

    Gets or sets a value that is used to group fields in the UI.

    public string GroupName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A value that is used to group fields in the UI.

    Remarks

    Do not use this property to get the value of the GroupName property. Use the GetDescription method instead. A null value or empty string is valid.

  • Name

    Gets or sets a value that is used for display in the UI.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A value that is used for display in the UI.

    Remarks

    Do not use this property to get the value of the Name property. Use the GetName method instead.

    The name is typically used as the field label for a UI element that is bound to the property that is annotated with this attribute. The Dynamic Data List.aspx, ListDetails.aspx, and Details.aspx page templates use the Name property for the field label. A null value or empty string is valid.

    Example

    The following example shows how to set the name property. 

    [MetadataType(typeof(EmployeeMD))]  
public partial class Employee {  
    public class EmployeeMD {  
        [Display(Name = "Last Name", Order = -9,   
        Prompt = "Enter Last Name", Description="Emp Last Name")]  
        public object LastName { get; set; }  

        [Display(Name = "Manager", AutoGenerateFilter=false)]  
        public object Employee1 { get; set; }  
    }  
}  

    <MetadataType(GetType(EmployeeMD))>  _  
Public Class Employee  

    Public Class EmployeeMD  

        <Display(Name:="Last Name", Order:=-9, _  
           Prompt:="Enter Last Name", Description:="Emp Last Name")>  _  
        Public Property LastName As Object  
        End Property  

        <Display(Name:="Manager", AutoGenerateFilter:=false)>  _  
        Public Property Employee1 As Object  
        End Property  
    End Class  
End Class
  • Order

    Gets or sets the order weight of the column.

    public int Order { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The order weight of the column.

    Remarks

    Columns are sorted in increasing order based on the order value. Columns without this attribute have an order value of 0. Negative values are valid and can be used to position a column before all non-negative columns. If an order is not specified, presentation layers should consider using the value 10000. This value lets explicitly-ordered fields be displayed before and after the fields that do not have a specified order.

    Example

    The following example shows how to set the order weight of the LastName field to -9. The other fields in the entity have the default order weight of zero. Therefore, the LastName field will be displayed first. 

    [MetadataType(typeof(EmployeeMD))]  
public partial class Employee {  
    public class EmployeeMD {  
        [Display(Name = "Last Name", Order = -9,   
        Prompt = "Enter Last Name", Description="Emp Last Name")]  
        public object LastName { get; set; }  

        [Display(Name = "Manager", AutoGenerateFilter=false)]  
        public object Employee1 { get; set; }  
    }  
}  

    <MetadataType(GetType(EmployeeMD))>  _  
Public Class Employee  

    Public Class EmployeeMD  

        <Display(Name:="Last Name", Order:=-9, _  
           Prompt:="Enter Last Name", Description:="Emp Last Name")>  _  
        Public Property LastName As Object  
        End Property  

        <Display(Name:="Manager", AutoGenerateFilter:=false)>  _  
        Public Property Employee1 As Object  
        End Property  
    End Class  
End Class
  • Prompt

    Gets or sets a value that will be used to set the watermark for prompts in the UI.

    public string Prompt { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A value that will be used to display a watermark in the UI.

    Remarks

    This property is typically used as a prompt or watermark for a UI element that is bound to the property that is annotated with this attribute. Do not use this method to access the prompt string. Use the GetPrompt method instead.

    Example

    The following example shows how to set the Prompt property to "Enter Last Name". 

    [MetadataType(typeof(EmployeeMD))]  
public partial class Employee {  
    public class EmployeeMD {  
        [Display(Name = "Last Name", Order = -9,   
        Prompt = "Enter Last Name", Description="Emp Last Name")]  
        public object LastName { get; set; }  

        [Display(Name = "Manager", AutoGenerateFilter=false)]  
        public object Employee1 { get; set; }  
    }  
}  

    <MetadataType(GetType(EmployeeMD))>  _  
Public Class Employee  

    Public Class EmployeeMD  

        <Display(Name:="Last Name", Order:=-9, _  
           Prompt:="Enter Last Name", Description:="Emp Last Name")>  _  
        Public Property LastName As Object  
        End Property  

        <Display(Name:="Manager", AutoGenerateFilter:=false)>  _  
        Public Property Employee1 As Object  
        End Property  
    End Class  
End Class
  • ResourceType

    Gets or sets the type that contains the resources for the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ShortName*, stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Name*, stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Prompt*, and stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description* properties.

    public Type ResourceType { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The type of the resource that contains the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ShortName*, stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Name*, stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Prompt*, and stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description* properties.

    Remarks

    If this value is null, the ShortName, Name, Prompt, and Description properties are assumed to be literal, non-localized strings. If this value is not null, the string properties are assumed to be the names of public static properties that return the actual string value.

  • ShortName

    Gets or sets a value that is used for the grid column label.

    public string ShortName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A value that is for the grid column label.

    Remarks

    The short name is used as the grid column label for a UI element that is bound to the property that is annotated with this attribute. The Dynamic Data Insert.aspx and Edit.aspx page templates use the ShortName for the field label. This property returns the localized string for ResourceType if the ResourceType property has been specified and if the ShortName property represents a resource key. If the ResourceType property has not been specified or if the ShortName property is not a resource key, this property returns a non-localized string.

Methods

  • GetAutoGenerateField()

    Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.AutoGenerateField* property.

    public Nullable<bool> GetAutoGenerateField ();

    Returns

    • Nullable<Boolean>

      The value of stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.AutoGenerateField* if the property has been initialized; otherwise, null.

  • GetAutoGenerateFilter()

    Returns a value that indicates whether UI should be generated automatically in order to display filtering for this field.

    public Nullable<bool> GetAutoGenerateFilter ();

    Returns

    • Nullable<Boolean>

      The value of stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.AutoGenerateFilter* if the property has been initialized; otherwise, null.

  • GetDescription()

    Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description* property.

    public string GetDescription ();

    Returns

    • String

      The localized description, if the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType* has been specified and the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description* property represents a resource key; otherwise, the non-localized value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description* property.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType* property and the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description* property are initialized, but a public static property that has a name that matches the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Description* value could not be found for the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType* property.

    Remarks

    The Description property is typically used as a tooltip for the property that is annotated with this attribute.

  • GetGroupName()

    Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.GroupName* property.

    public string GetGroupName ();

    Returns

    • String

      A value that will be used for grouping fields in the UI, if stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.GroupName* has been initialized; otherwise, null. If the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType* property has been specified and the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.GroupName* property represents a resource key, a localized string is returned; otherwise, a non-localized string is returned.

  • GetName()

    Returns a value that is used for field display in the UI.

    public string GetName ();

    Returns

    • String

      The localized string for the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Name* property, if the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType* property has been specified and the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Name* property represents a resource key; otherwise, the non-localized value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Name* property.

    Exceptions

    • InvalidOperationException

      The stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType* property and the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Name* property are initialized, but a public static property that has a name that matches the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Name* value could not be found for the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType* property.

    Remarks

    The name is typically used as the field label for a UI element that is bound to the property that is annotated with the Name property. A null value or empty string is valid.

  • GetOrder()

    Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Order* property.

    public Nullable<int> GetOrder ();

    Returns

    • Nullable<Int32>

      The value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Order* property, if it has been set; otherwise, null.

    Remarks

    If an order is not specified, presentation layers should consider setting the value of the Order property to 10000. This value lets explicitly-ordered fields be displayed before and after the fields that do not have a specified order.

  • GetPrompt()

    Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Prompt* property.

    public string GetPrompt ();

    Returns

    • String

      Gets the localized string for the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Prompt* property if the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType* property has been specified and if the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Prompt* property represents a resource key; otherwise, the non-localized value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.Prompt* property.

    Remarks

    The Prompt property is typically used as a prompt or watermark for a UI element that is bound to the property that is annotated with the Prompt attribute.

  • GetShortName()

    Returns the value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ShortName* property.

    public string GetShortName ();

    Returns

    • String

      The localized string for the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ShortName* property if the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ResourceType* property has been specified and if the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ShortName* property represents a resource key; otherwise, the non-localized value of the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DisplayAttribute.ShortName* value property.

    Remarks

    The short name is used as the grid column label for a UI element that is bound to the property that is annotated with this attribute. This property returns either the literal, non-localized string, or a localized string if ResourceType is not null.
